programmes.show_description: Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Kevin Bridges take on Jon Richardson and Rebecca Front. Joe Lycett joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With maths whizz Rachel Riley.
Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Charlie Brooker, Jedward, Lorraine Kelly and Micky Flanagan, to thrash out the hot themes of the week.
It's the penultimate episode of the series. Rhod Gilbert's at the centre of satsuma-based controversy.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
Carl and Brianha bring the French Riviera to Bognor Regis, with lasers and a smoke machine. Justin and Karen do fine dining. And is Mark and Lisa's curry too hot for their guests to handle?
In West Yorkshire, there are terrible jokes, comedy teeth, plate licking and a conga, as three couples compete to host the best dinner party.
The One with Two Left Shoes: Stuart has got a rollercoaster ride in store when planning his wedding to fiancée Vicky. And his troubles aren't helped by an interesting wardrobe malfunction.
The One with the Pool Party: Patrick wants to please everyone with his wedding to Emma, aiming to merge his wish for a gigantic pool party with her dream classy tradition.
The One with Bridezilla: James has got his work cut out to give self-confessed 'Bridezilla' Hollie her perfect day - which certainly doesn't include a last-minute, unplanned venue change.
The One with the Drunk Bride: Nick's planning an elaborate, celeb-style wedding to cater for his bride-to-be Laila. It might just prove too good for Laila come the big day, though.
The Amsterdam Stag One: Nurse Pippa has let fiancé Tony take control. Will his Dutch stag do - on which he takes her dad - distract him from selecting the perfect dress for his bride-to-be?
Anytime Fitness is a global firm, and it's the job of brand president Stacy Anderson to keep this gym giant in shape. Are all the employees on board with the planned changes?
TGI Fridays is one of the biggest restaurant chains. CEO Ray Blanchette wants to re-energise the brand, so he goes undercover to find out what staff think of his changes.
Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine: Gordon's in Pennsylvania to help rescue a soul food restaurant that was opened 12 years ago by a retired special education teacher.
Barefoot Bob's: Gordon visits Barefoot Bob's beachside restaurant in Massachusetts, where husband and wife Marc and Lisa struggle to attract customers during the winter months.
Gordon revisits Café Hon in Baltimore, Chiarella's in Philadelphia, and Leone's in New Jersey, to find out whether the owners have taken his advice on board.
Olde Hitching Post: Gordon visits the historic Olde Hitching Post restaurant in Massachusetts. Tom bought the business for his daughter but refuses to let her run it.
Levanti's: Gordon visits Pennsylvania, where he meets siblings whose inability to work together is risking their father's life savings at his Italian restaurant, Levanti's.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Katherine Ryan take on Jon Richardson and David Mitchell. Nick Helm joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Henning Wehn go up against Jon Richardson and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Tom Allen joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Joe Wilkinson.
An extended edition of the show, with guests Jack Dee, Kelly Osbourne, Micky Flanagan and Jamelia, who thrash out the hot topical themes of the week.
An extended edition of the show. Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by Tim Westwood, Lauren Laverne, David O'Doherty and Matthew Crosby.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Katherine Ryan take on Jon Richardson and David Mitchell. Nick Helm joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Henning Wehn go up against Jon Richardson and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Tom Allen joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Joe Wilkinson.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
The One with the Missing Stag: Paula's wanting a classic wedding, but planning isn't exactly groom Rodney's forte. And then he's nowhere to be seen on his stag night...
The One with the Wedding Casino: The last thing Linda wants is anything tacky, garish or themed. Groom James didn't get the memo, and has got a Las Vegas-inspired reception up his sleeve.
The Medieval One: Stephen's always imagined his wedding would be a grand, medieval affair. So that's exactly what he's planned for his bride-to-be Shelley, who just wants something normal.
Xavier Mufraggi, the CEO of Club Med North America, goes undercover, disguised as a laid-back surfer, in his own resorts, to see the impact that his growth plans are having.
As CEO, Wan Kim has doubled Smoothie King's number of stores and tripled sales. He goes undercover to find out what his changes have meant for his employees and customers.
In West Yorkshire, Sophie and Harj plan a Mexican menu, but can Harj find his way around the kitchen? Richard and Libby stick to British classics. Butcher Sean and Jane serve a meat feast.
High-flyers Bob and Louise, youngsters Will and Kim, and Iranian ex-pats Pasha and Haleh compete in Cheltenham, in a week of massive portions, a tale of heroism and Persian rice pudding.
In Gloucestershire, there's a malfunctioning blender, a singing dog, and plenty of catty comments, as Debbie and Paul, Angela and John, and Kirsty and James compete.
In Glasgow, there's an impromptu sing-song, a kitchen disaster and an MC battle, as three couples compete to host the best dinner party.
Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room: In California, Gordon visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room, where he tries to mend relationships between the owner, his wife and their children.
Nino's: Gordon visits Long Beach in California to save Nino's, a failing Italian restaurant that opened in 1958 and is now under the misguided leadership of eldest son Nino.
Mill Street Bistro (Part 1/2): Gordon visits Ohio. The owner of the Mill Street Bistro claims to have the best menu between New York and LA. But the diners don't agree.
Mill Street Bistro (Part 2/2): In the conclusion to the Mill Street Bistro saga, Gordon's disagreement with the proprietor erupts into one of his most intense confrontations yet.
Yanni's: Gordon Ramsay visits Greek restaurant Yanni's, where he clashes with owner Peter, a chef who hasn't changed his menu since the business opened in 1984.

programmes.show_name: Big Fat Quiz of the Year 2025
programmes.show_description: Jimmy Carr hosts as Jonathan Ross, Richard Ayoade, Katherine Ryan, Nick Mohammed, Roisin Conaty and Lou Sanders answer questions about Katy Perry, Lily Allen and THAT Coldplay concert.
Jimmy Carr hosts the topical comedy show as Jamie Laing, Jessica Knappett, Rose Matafeo and Geoff Norcott join team captains Rob Beckett and Katherine Ryan.
